subtitles.text: It's time for another episode of Upgami. This time we will be talking with Akari Takeuchi of Angulum and Yumeno Kishimoto of Tsubaki Factory.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the upfront group.
We will show you the process of recording and rehearsal.
So, first of all, let's take a look behind the scenes of the two MCs.
I, Akari Takeuchi, have a new single coming out on June 14,
I will be releasing two A-side singles, "Ai no Kedamono" and "Doukunin",
This "Ai no Kedamono" was really hard work.
I could never dance to that one.
It was really amazing. I couldn't physically do it anymore, and when I was a freelance dancer in the beginning, I couldn't even dance.
And it took me a long time to make it my own, so we all did it together.
So, I said, "Let's do intervals," and it was almost like a club activity.
We would dance as fast as we could, take a minute off, start the music right after a minute, do it again, take a break, do it one more time, and then we were done.
Three sets, and it was really the hardest thing I had ever done.
You did a menu like that?
I really felt like I was in an athletic club at school.
It was the last single, wasn't it?
Last single. That's why it was so hard, so it didn't feel like a last single at all.
I was really surprised myself. I didn't expect the last song to be this intense.
I really hope that if you haven't seen it yet, you should see it.
I will watch it a lot.
I, Kishimoto, have been practicing writing my own lyrics and songs recently, and I've even performed a little bit at some events,
I'm a bit biased, because most of the songs I write seem to be cute, and I guess I grew up in the Hello Project, but there's something a little matured about them.
I want to make songs that are a little bit more mature, that seem to be good at jazz or something, but I'd rather make cute songs in the idol style, like Matsuura E's debut.
I tend to make cute idol-type songs, like when E Matsuura made her debut.
So I decided to study various genres of music one more time so that I can make various kinds of songs.
I've been trying to listen to various kinds of music. Someday I hope to be able to
I hope to be able to showcase my music to many people somewhere.
Let's start off with this up-coming album,

So, I've seen the video of the new member's lesson, and I've heard that Morning Musume。 23, 17-year-old Haruka Inoue, a sophomore in high school, and 14-year-old Haruka Bow, a junior high school student, are the new members of Morning Musume
And Ayako Yumi-Shimoda, a 14-year-old junior high school student, has joined as a new member.
I watched the video of their exciting lesson, and I wondered what their first lesson was like.
I was in the 4th or 5th grade at the beginning of my first lesson, so I don't remember much about it.

I don't even remember the first lesson, but I was wondering how I would be able to express myself as a member of Morning Musume。 I'm really looking forward to see how they will polish their expressive ability and how they will change as a member of Morning Musume。

I'm really looking forward to seeing how they will polish their expressive ability as a member of Morning Musume and how they will change. KishimotoMy first voice training singing lesson was during the audition for Morning Musume。 I remember now, it was a lip roll.
I remember now, I couldn't even do a lip roll. I couldn't even do that. I couldn't even do a lip roll. I was at that level, practicing all night long.
But I started out not being able to do it at all. But I desperately tried my best, and I was able to make it to this wonderful group of seniors, all of whom have wonderful voices.

I am sure that I will become a person with a wonderful singing voice. I am sure that this will happen, so I would like to encourage all the new members of the various teams to work hard and do their best.
That's all for now. 23 new member lesson video.

It's time for Akari Takeuchi and Yumeno Kishimoto to say goodbye to Upokami!

I, Kishimoto, have been watching various videos of up-cam, and I've seen them in various combinations, and I've seen them on my cell phone at home, and I've seen them in various combinations, and I've seen them on my cell phone at home.
I'm always watching the videos on my cell phone at home, but I felt I was able to enjoy them twice as much as I usually do.
I realized how important it is to have someone to watch with.
So let's continue to watch together at home!
It's the last time you're going to MC today, right?
Yes, I think it's the last one.
I'm glad we could do the last one together, and I made some discoveries, so let's continue to watch it together at home.
Let's watch it together at home from now on.
I'd like to watch it on the big screen with the TV connected.

I would be surprised if you said it was the last one, but this time there was a video of recording, and this time it was a recording of a joyous instrument, but I was surprised to hear that it was the last one.
I was also able to learn a lot about how our new songs are made through up-cam videos.
I also had a lot of footage of my own recording sessions.
I've become a fan of mine more than I imagined.
I was surprised at the number of people who became my fans after seeing these recording videos.
This is the reason why I became a fan.
That's why I was so happy to be a part of Up-Cami.
It's an important place for you.
Thanks to you, I now have the support of so many people.
I would like to continue to see the new songs of Ange and the other side of the junior members as a viewer, so please do your best.

Upcami will be going behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group. We will introduce you to the parts you don't normally see, so please subscribe to our channel!
This time, upcami's partners are Akari Takeuchi of Angulum and Yume Kishimoto of Tsubaki Factory.
